node.title: U.S. Leads Globe in New COVID Cases, Europe Sees Drop After Weeks of Gains, WHO Finds
node.description: The U.S. registered the most new COVID cases in the world over the last week, over 752,000, and the global weekly count of deaths rose by 10 percent last week.

node.title: Thai Court Upholds Sentence for Premchai Karnasuta, Who Poached, Cooked Black Panther
node.description: Park rangers found the construction tycoon in February of 2018 with guns and several slain animals, including the black panther that was butchered and cooked.

node.title: Mark Simon, Capitol Rioter Who Sold Trump Hats for Drugs, Wouldn't've Been In D.C. if Sober
node.description: Mark Simon told a judge that supporting former President Donald Trump was a "bad mistake" he made during his relapse.

node.title: Facebook Takes More Action Against Myanmar Military After $150B Lawsuit Filed By Refugees
node.description: Facebook is banning pages representing businesses controlled by Myanmar's military, a day after a $150 billion lawsuit was filed against the company.

node.title: James Lucien Freed After 27 Years in Prison on Wrongful Conviction Tied to Police Coverup
node.description: "The person to blame is the lead detective in this case. Detective Brazil," Judge Robert Ullman said. Brazil had been the one to charge James Lucien originally.

node.title: Risdiplam is a life-changing drug for Eleanor, but it comes with $400,000-a-year price tag
node.description: Disability rights activist and science journalist Eleanor Beidatsch explains why life-changing medications, which help people with a degenerative disability, should be made available to all.

node.title: Monthly child tax credit payments set to expire
node.description: The IRS has told some lawmakers the bill needs to pass by December 28 for payments to continue smoothly heading into January, according to Senate and House congressional aides.

node.title: Does It Make Sense to Categorize People by Generation?
node.description: In “The Generation Myth,” Bobby Duffy deconstructs the stereotypes that have built up around millennials, boomers and other cohorts.

node.title: Catharsis Songs
node.description: Big feelings, big playlist.

node.title: Your Thursday Briefing: Pfizer’s Booster and Omicron.
node.description: The booster protects, and two shots may not be enough.

node.title: The Coronavirus Attacks Fat Tissue, Scientists Find
node.description: The research may help explain why people who are overweight and obese have been at higher risk of severe illness and death from Covid.

node.title: Maine Hospitals Overwhelmed With Unvaccinated Patients Forces National Guard Activation
node.description: "There are a record high 379 people hospitalized with COVID-19 in Maine, including 117 in critical care and 60 on ventilators," Maine Governor Janet Mills said.

node.title: Rev. Craig Duke Says He Was 'Bullied Out' of Church After Appearing in Drag Queen Show
node.description: "It was a matter of sadness and disappointment and heartbreak on my part ... realizing I was losing the ability to lead," Rev. Craig Duke said.

node.title: Dramatic arrest on Sydney bridge linked to alleged Stuart MacGill kidnapping
node.description: Police say the arrest of a 28-year-old man on the Anzac Bridge yesterday came as part of an investigation into the alleged kidnapping of a former Test cricket star.

node.title: Nerves and celebration as Katherine exits lockout amid COVID-19 concerns
node.description: After three weeks of COVID-19 restrictions, 63 cases and the tragic passing of an Aboriginal elder from the nearby remote community of Binjari, Katherine is now open for business.

node.title: Deputy Prime Minister Barnaby Joyce tests positive for COVID-19 in US
node.description: Deputy Prime Minister and Nationals Leader Barnaby Joyce has tested positive for COVID-19 after arriving in the United States.

node.title: Mini-MIQ: What happens if you test positive for Covid-19 while on holiday
node.description: Locations of mini-MIQs around the country are being kept under wraps as health authorities in the provinces prepare for a deluge of visitors over summer.

node.title: Wood over beaches in central Gisborne a summer 'eyesore'
node.description: It's not just R&V that has gone in Gisborne for summer, a day at the beach might be out too.

node.title: Scott Peterson re-sentenced to life in prison without parole
node.description: Scott Peterson was convicted in the 2002 deaths of his wife Laci and their unborn child Connor.

node.title: ‘Fatal Distraction’ Review: Parents Go Through the Unthinkable
node.description: In the documentary by Susan Morgan Cooper, a father is on trial after his baby dies in the back seat of a hot car.

node.title: Company to Pay $40M Over Allegations it Raised Price of Exclusive Drug By 4000 Percent
node.description: Vyera Pharmaceuticals LLC and its parent company will pay $40 million over a 10-year period after increasing the price of Daraprim from $17.50 to $750 per pill.

node.title: Rashida Tlaib Tears Up Calling for Boebert to Be Punished: 'We Shouldn't Have to Beg'
node.description: A resolution was introduced Wednesday to strip Lauren Boebert of her committee assignments over her anti-Muslim remarks.

node.title: The Supreme Court Faces a Voting Paradox
node.description: Any voting system is vulnerable to inconsistency.

node.title: Mercedes F1 Team Ends Sponsorship Deal With Company Tied to Deadly Grenfell Tower Fire
node.description: Kingspan, a building materials company, said in a statement that it was "deeply aware of the sensitivities raised in recent days'' because of the deal.

node.title: Pot Brownie Weighing 850 Pounds Revealed as 'World's Largest'
node.description: The massive treat was made using 20,000 milligrams of THC and took five confectioners more than 24 hours to bake.

node.title: Anti-Vaccine Doctor John Witcher Says He Was Fired for Using Ivermectin on COVID Patients
node.description: Dr. John Witcher said he took three patients off of an FDA-approved COVID-19 medication and replaced it with ivermectin, which has not been approved for COVID.

node.title: Tiger Woods will make his return to golf after car crash
node.description: Woods, 45, says he'll participate in the PNC Championship with his 12-year-old son, Charlie.

node.title: Yes, Americans Should Get Free Tests
node.description: We need every option available to return to normal.

node.title: Elizabeth Holmes Rests Her Case in Fraud Trial
node.description: Lawyers must now agree on a set of jury instructions before closing arguments begin on Dec. 16.

node.title: The Era of the Celebrity Meal
node.description: Fast-food chains are hungry for celebrity partners to drive sales and appeal to younger consumers. The method is working.
